notesStmt.note: Folios 217r-217v contain doodles. Comments of a non-masoretic character are found throughout, e.g. 42v, 45r. A Hebrew subscription on folio 216v, with a date of 18 Marheshvan 1954, i.e. 1642, and the name of the city of Ma'abar, due to a later hand. Aharon ha-Kohen, inscribed with his name on folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Former Prophets with Targum, punctuated, with masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 22 quires of 10 leaves each, apart from the last of 7 leaves only. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last page (lost after 11th quire).

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Former Prophets with Targum. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2371.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881, folio [220v].
